lines.text: Did you find a job?
Yeah, I got something at the striptease. I help the girls dress and undress.
Nice job.
Twenty francs a week.
Not very much.
It's all I can afford.
Look, I know you'll think this is crazy, but, er, when the light hits me from a certain direction, I'm... handsome
[swigs from bottle]
"Please do not take me away, I will not do it again."
Brilliant quote.
He was a brilliant pervert.
You're grotesque!
Lascivious adulterer!
Don't you dare call me that again until I have looked it up!
Is she prettier than me?
Is she prettier than you? I'M prettier than YOU!
You got something to eat?

[Looking around his messy kitchen]
Some, uh, some fig-newtons and some hershey bars and some cough drops
You got any tuna fish?

[Searching cupboard]
Tunafish... Tunafish... I have some salmon salad left
What do you mean, left? When did you make it?
In April but if you smother it with pepper it's fine.
I am a doctor of the mind.
Really?
Yes!
I have terrible emotional problems. Could you help me?
You certainly picked a very odd time to ask me, just in the middle of a suicide.
Silence when you're shouting at me!
You'll like this group analysis, it's a real freak show. If it gets dull, we sing songs.
I'll be back tomorrow. If I'm not back tomorrow, send for the police. If they're not back tomorrow, send my clothes.
If it fails, then we'll try something else, because I use all kinds of unorthodox methods. For example, I've had the greatest success shutting people in dark closets.

[leafing through a dictionary]
"Lascivious adulterer... a man who is a lascivious adulterer"? What kind of book is this?
I'll see you next Friday - I've got a few phone calls to make.
But I haven't finished - I've only been here fifteen minutes.
I can't take more than fifteen minutes of your sex life at one time.
When the light hits him a certain way, he's almost handsome.
[Liz has just taken an overdose of pills at Michael's apartment for the third time]
Mademoiselle, the boys at the Emergency Suicide ward have voted to give you this gold watch for unusual devotion.
Would you excuse me for a minute? I'm going into the bathroom to take an overdose of sleeping pills.
I like you. You're a nice stable girl.
[delivers a Wagnerian Valkyrie yodel]
Who is that thing?
That is no thing, it's my wife!
As a man's life goes down the drain, you are there.
Oh, Michael, this can't work, I'm 34 and you're 12!
Don't be negative.
What in the name of all that's gracious is a semi-virgin?
You're right. I must face my problems. I can't go through life being a semi-virgin.
What, in the name of all that is gracious, is a semi-virgin?
Here, I'm a virgin. In America, I'm not.
What do they do? Stamp it on your passport?

[Liz Bien, the stripper, has just made her second suicide attempt while in Michael's company. The same ER doctor has responded]
You wouldn't happen to be the young lady's fiancee, would you?
No, just a friend.
Pretty rough friendship you've got there.
[Carole has taken Michael's car keys]
Give me the key.
No. Take a cab.
I don't wish to take a key, I want my carcabs!
We're married thirty seconds and already you look at other women.
I had to look at her, she was talking to me, I looked in the direction the sound was coming from.
Do you have any salt?
Have I got any salt? I got a boat, I got kerosene, matches, firecrackers, two swords, and this flag. But, I ain't got no salt.
My wife, the creature that ate Europe, is here.
I just burnt my finger! I'm going to go in the bathroom and scream. I'll be out in a minute.
In Britain, we have a national therapy, we call it cricket. Unlike other sports, it doesn't involve anxieties or pressures. It's leisurely and lyrical. It's the song of willow on leather.
Is there any sex in it?
Oh, no. This is a game for gentlemen, played by gentlemen.
It's sick, sick.
Foiled by a cheap cinematic trick!
I, uh, decided to follow you here.
If you followed me here, how did you contrive to be here before me?
I followed you... very fast.
May I explain that what you see happening here is merely an illusion...
An illusion?
An illusion. Shut the door, count three...
Three?
Four, if you like, but close the door and you'll see it's just an illusion.
I can't spell Sigismund.
I think that you have a little sexual block over the spelling of that naughty name. Allow me to help you, I'm a psychoanalyst, among other things.
We played strip chess. She had me down to my shorts and I fainted from tension.
I've hated you from the first moment I married you!
When did all this come to an end?
It didn't come to an end! That's the point.
You are a monster and a monster, in that order.
I've had a lot of experience fondling, er, handling young women like you. And it's all got to stop.
Pussycat from the sky, I can't resist you.
Don't resist. Capitulate.

[Richard Burton in cameo appearance]
Excuse me, haven't *you* seen *me* somewhere before?
I know the name, but I can't remember the face.
You see, I can't help it, I'm a physical woman. I feel guilty about it. But I come from a family of acute nymphomaniacs. That includes my father and my two brothers.
My darling! Your face is like the pale autumn moon!
Ahhh. A little gentle steam does one the world of good. We must have physical health as well as mental health. Ah, I'm kinky for steam!

[in a dream]
RIGHT! I want ALL YOU CATS... to SHAPE UP!
[cracks whip madly]
Could you tell me about your typical clientele?
My typical clientele?
Typical.
All the people who are here now are typical clientele.
Really?
There is a man cheating on his wife in room Lola Montez. There is a woman cheating on her two husbands in Carlotta. Two lovers of indeterminate sex in Reine Margot. And two men cheating in Don Juan.
Yes. Well, once might say the joint is jumping.
Pardon me, drunk, but you can't come in here.

[Addressing group therapy class]
Where did we leave off last session?
When the train entered the tunnel.
Pointing to Rita "This is a personal friend of James Bond"
You got something to eat?

[Looking around his messy kitchen]
Some, uh, some Fig Newtons and some Hershey bars and some cough drops.
You got any tuna fish?

[Searching cupboard]
Tuna fish... tuna fish... I have some salmon salad left.
What do you mean, left? When did you make it?
In April, but if you smother it with pepper it's fine.
